name: Ztar Attack Rebooted
summary: SM64 Ztar Attack Rebooted is a rom hack made by TheGael95 and Aglab2, it is a remake of Super Mario 64 1.5 Ztar Attack! featuring 170 Ztars, reworked smaller levels and new gimmicks.

name: Ztar Attack: Mario Escape from the Jail - Definitive Edition
summary:
Mario: Escape from the Jail - Definitive Edition is a ROM hack which contains 5 main courses and several side courses to explore and 50 collectable stars. This hack is a remaster of the original Escape from the Jail, made in 2016. This marks the second hack contributed in remaking a game of the Ztar Attack series, as well as the third game not made by the original creator (the first being Forest Ruins: Rebooted; the second being Ztar Attack Rebooted).

Following the story, this game unfolds as a prequel to Ztar Attack under the brand "Ztar Attack 0.5". Unlike Ztar Attack Rebooted, the game uses the original level layout but key sections are condensed by quality standards -- visuals and exploration alike. Plus, newer gameplay tech and custom assets are implemented.

name: Z-Tack
summary: As in Imagic's Atlantis, the city is under attack, but in this case, you are the invader. Destroy the installations while they try to stop you. Many of the installations are hidden in caverns, so you'll need a precision shot to hit them.

name: zTime (Danger Noodles!)
summary: Top down action-survival gameplay becomes a symphony of interweaving 3D paths where the future is visualized along with the present and players have time to change events before it's too late.

name: ZType
summary: A Type-to-shoot Space Shoot'em'up. Type in the words above the spaceships to destroy them. The fewer spelling mistakes you make the higher the score.

name: Ztar Attack 0.5: Mario Escape from the Jail
summary: Mario has been arrested for a crime he didn't commit! Can you break out, and uncover a conspiracy along the way?

name: ZTetris
summary:
ZTetris is the classic TI calculator clone of the popular Tetris game that everybody has played, and that has been made for all kinds of gaming platforms. The original game was programmed in assembly by Jimmy Mardell for the TI-85 and executed via ZShell, but the game has since been ported to every TI graphing calculator by other members of the community.

The game has an impressive list of features, including two-player linkplay (which even works between every TI graphing calculator), 21 levels, top 3 high scores saved with names, 16 different alternating background patterns, trash lines, and even a teacher key.

name: Z: The End
summary: Z: The End is a top-down shooter survival game set in a world infested with zombies. Explore a world destroyed by disease, scavenge for supplies and weapons, and survive as long as you can against the zombies and nature.

name: z-Tech
summary: z-Tech is a 2D puzzle-platformer like Portal. The main character, Miko, is an android who has to go through complex levels in a space station.

name: Ztar Attack 2: A Blast to the Past
summary: A linear Super Mario 64 hack, Bowser has destroyed the seal that protects the Kingdom from the Ztars and kidnapped the Princess! Mario must collect the Time Stars to fix the seal, and save the day.
